intro: Roeperocharis cardiochila, commonly known as the red-flowered rock orchid, is a rare and endemic species found in specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking red petals and is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and exhibits typical orchid morphology with a slender stem and a single, showy flower. Its unique coloration and habitat preferences make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to its limited distribution and threats from habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable.
